Summary: While night driving two women observe and stop to observe a bright object in a clear sky changing color from red to blue and performing variable vertical and horizontal movements over a 45 minute period.
Object Flight Path: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering

There was one other sighting in Fort Collins on or around August 16th 2006
divs: sighting detailson receiving an email request from mufon headquarters i telephoned the named witness, sylvia, at the phone number provided around 8:40 pm mdt. i stated who i was and why i was calling and sylvia began to recount what she and her roommate, rebecca, had observed the night before. i found both women to still be excited over what they had seen and eager to tell me about their shared experience. here is a summary of what i learned from the pair. hereafter the case has been assigned to fi cheryl gantz for a more thorough onsite investigation, to which both witnesses have agreed. the women were returning home to fort collins after spending some time in estes park, colorado, when sylvia, the passenger in the vehicle, noticed a bright object in the western night sky that she characterized as brighter than a commercial aircraft's lights and changing color from red to blue\green. shortly into her description of the object she began to eliminate a number of natural and man-made possibilities including a bright star and planets as well as a plane\jet\helicopter as likely explanation for what she was viewing. she described the object's motions from two perspectives 1) while riding in an automobile and 2) having stopped and stepped outside the vehicle to observe the object from a fixed position. at various times she and her roommate both indicated that the object had moved in vertical as well as horizontal movements over a roughly 45 minute period. the location from which they attained their best viewing was from horsetooth reservoir, just west of fort collins, colorado. the speed of its motions were described as being variable, sometimes rapid, sometimes more leisurely. both noted that when commercial aircraft flew into the area that the object under observation would descend. of note, sylvia only mentioned that she had observed a smaller "ball-shaped" object in the vicinity of the larger object but provided few details. this may be due to the fact that she was unhindered by driving provided that my memory remains accurate on that point. each witness expressed excitement and feeling overwhelmed at what they had observed the night before and it was still present in their voices over the phone. i found each to be starightforward in their recounting of the previous night's events and at this point have no reason to doubt their sincerity. both witnesses reported that they lost sight of the object as it appeared to fade and drop below a mountain that was their horizon. during the course of her account sylvia also volunteered that on at least one occasion she was able to observe the reflection of a commercial aircraft in the reservoir as it passed overhead. however, she expressed feeling some confusion as to why, then, she was unable to view the reflection of the unidentified light above as well. both witnesses claimed other people at the reservoir were observing the object from various points. including themselves, in all they tallied 9 witnesses; 2 people traveling by motorbike, 2 cars containing 2 adults each and 1 child. both sylvia and rebecca noted that the child showed excitement during the event. sylvia characterized the shape of the object as pyramid-shaped or a-shaped with concise edges. rebecca offered no information about the object's appearance other than the same red\green\blue. rebecca reported leaving estes park around 10:30 pm mdt on august 16, 2006, and both generally agreed that the beginning of their observations began around 11:30 pm mdt until roughly 12:15 am mdt on august 17. ethan rich fi, ssd colorado mufon director, investigations august 17, 2006
